Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

Mission Introduction - Part 1: Commander’s Personal Record: Vanguard Expeditionary Forces. Cryosleep cycle completed – no casualties. Time since launch: 197 years. Target planet secured. Void rift created and stabilized. One complication: Communications with the Star Union still failing. The probes sent through the rift detected the cause: A heavy Void Storm is blocking our signals – and our return.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Introduction - Part 2: We have a way off this rock. Some kind of harmonic lull in the Void Storm. Our new target is Leave-6, the military transit hub in this section of the borderlands. Part of my crew is already speculating about the Elysium Parks of tomorrow. Personally, I never gave a damn about such front soldier entertainment, but it’s good to see ship morale rise again.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Introduction - Part 3: Something is wrong. We made it through the Void in one piece, but instead of Vanguard Rift Patrol there was only scattered wreckage awaiting our arrival. While searching for survivors, we spotted a ship of unknown configuration. It ignored our hails, retreating into the planet’s atmosphere. Residual void interference prevents us from scanning the surface. We’re preparing a landing party.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Introduction - Part 4: Our new mission is clear: We need to assess the strategic situation on Leave-6, contact Vanguard Central Command – and help them clean up this mess. Prepare for Planetfall! For the Vanguard! And for the Union!
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Outro - Part 1: Although the crisis on Leave 6 has come to an end, the fate of the Star Union remains uncertain. We know now that because of the Void Storms the planet lost contact to the Union approximately 170 years ago. However this doesn‘t explain why there haven‘t shown up any imperial ships since the storms began to subside nor why Sina and the Syndicate could act so ruthlessly after their arrival. I could still be wrong with this, but I fear the chaos and destruction we encountered here may have been only the beginning.
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context

Mission Outro - Part 2: To rise like a phoenix from the ashes. This is how the Prometheans used to embellish their murdering and destruction and I always despised them for their war crimes. However even I have to admit that in difficult times like this their technology can be useful: For survival, protection and diplomatic intimidation. Because even if the Syndicate aren’t part of a greater Outlander invasion force I want to be prepared the next time we meet. They have asked for fire. They shall have it!
Spoken by Jack Gelder; added for context
"Jack Gelder" is the default name of the playable character in the mission. The character can be customized by the player to be either male or female.
{STR_LeaderName} is a string insertion variable of the player character (Jack Gelder) name. It will be replaced by the name chosen by the player during leader customization.
"Colonel" is the military title of Jack Gelder within the Vanguard.
"Leave-6" is the name of the planet.
"Vanguard Central" is the name of the military command gremium in power when the Star Union still existed.
"Lt. Jiang" refers to Daiyu Jiang (female Vanguard campaign character)
Daiyu Jiang is the name of a female Vanguard campaign character.
"Tappels" is the name of a unique Vanguard PUG unit. The robot is a pet of Daiyu Jiang,
"sleeper mission" refers to the cryo-sleep missions where the Vanguard are sent to claim distant planets by spending the decades (or centuries) of flight time in cryogenic stasis.

"the Void" is the subspace connecting the game universe with other dimension and universes. It is entered and left through Spatial Rifts to quickly travel between star systems with faster than light speed.
"Void Storms" are cosmic storms that can occur within the Void. They impede travelling or communicating through the Void.
"Spatial Rift" refers to the cosmic rifts connecting the physical world with the Void.
"Michael Valentine" is the name of a male Vanguard campaign character.
"Ruby Squad" refers to the Vanguard under command of Michael Valentine, a male Vanguard campaign character.
"Huy Jiang" is the name of a male Vanguard campaign character. He is the nephew of Daiyu Jiang (she is his aunt).
"Emerald Squad" refers to the Vanguard under command of Huy Jiang, a male Vanguard campaign character.
"Fang" refers to "Fang Jiang", the father of Huy Jiang and brother of Daiyu Jiang.
"Sina of House Timur" is the name of a female Syndicate campaign character.
"Saphire Squad" refers to the Vanguard under command of Colonel Garou, a male Vanguard.
"Molten Earth Arsenal" is the name of a unique sector on the map (with a Promethean landmark).
"Tricorium" is the name of a strong and rare metal.
"Outlanders" refers to a non-homogenous group of out-casts and started rebelling against the Star Union at some of its outer-borders planets.
"Laura-2" is the name of a female Elysium Park robot.
"Emma-3" is the name of a female Elysium Park robot.
"Ilia-5-3" is the name of a female Elysium Park robot.
"Michael-4" is the name of a male Elysium Park robot.
"Emperor Khansu" is the name of a Star Union emperor that died by igniting his home world with PyrX fire, turning it into his planetary tomb.
"Aethron" is the name of a valuable psionically charged substance.
"House Timur" is the name of a Syndicate clan.
"Cerebral control collar" is the name of a Syndicate unit ability. It is used to subdue humanoids and turn them into slaves (or in game Syndicate Indentured units).
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.
Name of a unique world map sector.

Leave-6 is in a desolate state. The planet is shrouded by radiation clouds and on the surface there appears to be little more left than ruins. Investigate the planet and find out what lead to that destruction.

With base camp set, we’re ready to march out. Down here it’s the same desolate image as in orbit: It’s all desert and charred ruins. The tropical paradise Vanguard Central created for their soldiers gone to hell. Someone has been fighting a war here. The question is who and when?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

So far none of our standard frequency calls have been answered. If there are any survivors, they are either cut off from communications or unwilling to talk. Time to search the old-fashioned way, with our laser rifles ready.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Send out your OWL scouts to look for any Star Union presence in the vicinity.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: Not all armies on the strategic map are hostile to you. Only when an army banner is showing a skull you should be careful to interact with it.)[/recommendedcol]
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Biep, biep, blililiep, blieeeep … (The robot ambles playfully.)
Story message. Speaker: "Tappels" (unique Vanguard PUG unit; the robot is a pet of Daiyu Jiang)
Would you look at that, Lt. Jiang!? Your little friend is making himself comfortable in this rotten place.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Lt. Jiang" refers to Daiyu Jiang (female Vanguard campaign character)

Yes, Sir. But it’s no surprise! My brother used to be stationed at one of the Leave-6 Repair Stations. This is where we assembled Tappels. He must be feeling he’s close to his - … Hey! Tappels! What do you think you are doing?!

Yes, Ma'am. But it’s no surprise! My brother used to be stationed at one of the Leave-6 Repair Stations. This is where we assembled Tappels. He must be feeling he’s close to his - … Hey! Tappels! What do you think you are doing?!
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Sir/Ma'am" refers to Jack Gelder. "Repair Stations" is the plural name of a strategic world map structure.
Bieeep. Blieeeelieeeep. (The robot slips through one of the still unfinished sections of the camp wall. He dashes straight into the desert.)
Story message. Speaker: "Tappels" (unique Vanguard PUG unit; the robot is a pet of Daiyu Jiang)
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Find out where Lt. Jiang's pet PUG has run off to.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: This is an adventure quest. Make sure to bring an army when you move to the target location.)[/recommendedcol]
A task description. "Lt. Jiang's pet PUG" is referring to Tappels.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.

Looks like our little robot friend has found himself some company. Though, wait a second - aren't these road sweeper units, patrolling the streets? I may not be an expert on maintenance robots, but the last time I checked they didn't require any laser guns to do their clean-up. Troop hygiene must have really dropped since we’ve left.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "road sweeper units" and "maintenance robots" both refers to Autonom units.
Ha! Good one, Commander! Though I doubt this place has seen any visitors that would have appreciated a clean walkway in quite a while. It looks completely deserted.
Agreed! Either way, I suggest we interrupt this particular mopping up, before your little pet gets blown into pieces.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Looks like Daiyu’s little robot friend has found himself some company. Those road sweeper units patrolling the streets don’t appear to be overly friendly though. We better get down there to help before the last memory of my lost friend is turned into dust as well.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "road sweeper units" refers to Autonom units.

Rescue Tappels before it gets attacked by the maintenance droids.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: Some landmarks need to be entered to fight its defenders. Move your army onto the structure to be able to enter it.)[/recommendedcol]
A task description. "maintenance robots" refers to Autonom units.
Biep. Bliehieeep! (The robot euphorically jumps from Daiyu Jiang to {STR_LeaderName}, slewing its antenna in excitement.)

Story message. Speaker: "Tappels" (unique Vanguard PUG unit; the robot is a pet of Daiyu Jiang) {STR_LeaderName} is a string insertion variable of the player character (Jack Gelder) name. It will be replaced by the name chosen by the player during leader customization.
Requires a localization note on what is inserted in {STR_LeaderName}.
Come here Tappels! … now there’s a good boy! Though you have to promise to never run away like that again! Just look what you got all of us into!

Looking around may actually be worthwhile in this occasion, Lieutenant. Do you remember how all the ships here had been polished and flagged for our launch day? Now they look as if they belonged into a museum or the deconstruction hangars on Gardip XX. Almost makes me feel like a living ghost.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Gardip XX" is the name of a planet used by the Star Union as a garbage-dump.
Biep. Bliehieeep! (The robot euphorically jumps to {STR_LeaderName}, then expectedly its head turns 360 degrees.)
Story message. Speaker: "Tappels" (unique Vanguard PUG unit; the robot is a pet of Daiyu Jiang)
Requires a localization note on what is inserted in {STR_LeaderName}.
I am sorry, boy, but our friend won’t be here to join us today. Come here now … I know, it isn’t easy. Here we go, there’s a good bot-doggy!
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Story message. Speaker: "Tappels" (unique Vanguard PUG unit; the robot is a pet of Daiyu Jiang)

This place used to be a space port. I still remember how all the ships had been polished and flagged for the launch day of our mission. Now they look as if they belonged into a museum or the deconstruction hangars on Gardip XX. Almost makes me feel like a living ghost.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Gardip XX" is the name of a planet used by the Star Union as a garbage-dump.

Oh no, Tappels! Now they got you too, old boy![br/][br/]...[br/][br/]When this is all over, I swear to you, I won’t rest before I have put you back together, my friend! Maybe I’ll upgrade your self-preservation subroutines.
Bloody bastards! They destroyed Tappels. First Daiyu, now her little robot friend. Collect the parts. When things calm down, I’ll fix you myself. How hard could it be?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Speaking of ships though, we have to double our efforts to find the alien ship we chased down from orbit. It will be better to get on their tracks before they can prepare any nasty surprises.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Now that we've got you back, we have to double our efforts to find the alien ship we chased down from orbit. It will be better to get on their tracks before they can prepare any nasty surprises.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "You" references the Tappels droid.
Locate the landing spot of the unknown vessel.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: This is an exploration quest. Use your scout units or other fast moving units to complete it.)[/recommendedcol]
Stop! Hold it right there, filthy renegades! Return to your hovels immediately and we won’t have to put you down like dogs.
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Solider" (Paragon Trooper unit, male)
What is this madness, soldier? Is that how the returning crew of a sleeper mission is welcomed home these days? Step aside! Let me talk to your superiors.

Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "sleeper mission" refers to the cryo-sleep missions where the Vanguard are sent to claim distant planets by spending the decades (or centuries) of flight time in cryogenic stasis.

A sleeper mission? Impossible! There are no more ships arriving from the Void. Don’t lie to me. Ruby Squad, Emerald Squad, Sapphire Squad, you’re all madmen![br/][br/]You know what? We’ll let you speak with the Prefect. He’ll show you how we deal with traitors…

Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Solider" (Paragon Trooper unit, male) "the Void" is the subspace connecting the game universe with other dimension and universes. It is entered and left through Spatial Rifts to quickly travel between star systems with faster than light speed. "Ruby Squad" refers to the Vanguard under command of Michael Valentine, a male Vanguard campaign character. "Emerald Squad" refers to the Vanguard under command of Huy Jiang, a male Vanguard campaign character. "Saphire Squad" refers to the Vanguard under command of Colonel Garou, a male Vanguard. For "Prefect" see the matching glossary entry.

It’s hard to believe these wretched creatures were once proud Star Union citizens. I always felt the Paragon were going too far with their cybernetic enhancements, but this? Are they even still human?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

And what about calling us renegades? Have their brains gone rotten as well or is there something more to this? Time to talk to their Prefect. Vanguard Central Command will know what is going on. In the meantime, we should keep our eyes open for the commanders of the Ruby, Emerald and Sapphire Squad they mentioned. They could be trouble.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Prove your good intentions to the Paragon and reach a peaceful relation with them.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: To increase relations with an NPC Faction, interact with their armies to receive quests or access their Dwelling on the strategic map to make purchases within the faction's dwelling shop.)[/recommendedcol]

Who treads there in the shadows of my throne, hiding like thieves? Come closer, into the light! Let me see your faces …[br/][br/]Ah, it is you, the ones who claim to have returned through the Spatial Rift! Tell me soldier, what was the name and designation of your mission?
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Prefect" (Paragon, male; the leader of the Paragon on a particular planet) "Spatial Rift" refers to the cosmic rifts connecting the physical world with the Void.

My name is {STR_LeaderName}, commanding officer of the ‘V.E.S. Frontier’. We secured the Kitoni system, deployed through a type 4 cryo-sleep mission 197 years ago. That being said and with all due respect, you better have a bloody good reason to treat us like this!

Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "V.E.S. Frontier" is the name of a space ship. V.E.S. Is the short from of "Vanguard Expeditionary Ship". "Kitoni system" is the name of a star system. "cryo-sleep" mission refers to the deep-space missions where the Vanguard are sent to claim distant planets by spending the decades (or centuries) of flight time in cryogenic stasis.

197 years, 58 days and 20 hours ago, to be precise – the Frontier seemed like a fine ship back then. Congratulations, Commander, you have passed! So it is true … the Void Storms have subsided. This is excellent news! I would invite you all to a celebratory dinner, but as you must have noticed, we are barely sustaining ourselves.

Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Prefect" (Paragon, male; the leader of the Paragon on a particular planet) "Frontier" is the name of a space ship. "Void Storms" are cosmic storms that can occur within the Void. They impede travelling or communicating through the Void.

I do owe you an apology, Commander. Though you must understand our situation: When the planet lost contact to Vanguard Central Command, it had no means of supply. Soldiers make for bad farmers, and as rations grew short tensions within the Vanguard began to boil. They split into different parties, the Emerald, Ruby and Sapphire Squad, while alas only few remained loyal to the Paragon.
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Prefect" (Paragon, male; the leader of the Paragon on a particular planet)

Since then, they have been fighting over food, weapons and resources, laying waste to the planet with experimental Promethean weaponry. They assault anyone and raided all other Paragon command posts. We were desperate, but now, with your arrival and the prospect of rejoining the Union, we can surely put an end to this tragedy!
Story message. Speaker: "Paragon Prefect" (Paragon, male; the leader of the Paragon on a particular planet)
The Vanguard on Leave-6 have split up in different Squads, fighting out their own personal civil war. Learn about the reasons of that conflict and bring it to an end - one way or another.

Search for the leaders of the Emerald Squad, Ruby Squad and Sapphire Squad mentioned by the Paragon Soldier.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: This is an exploration quest. Use your scout units or other fast moving units to complete it.)[/recommendedcol]

What is this? New recruits? Have you come to prove yourself to the great Huy Jiang and his Emerald Squad? Be strong! Be quick-minded! Be disciplined! Master your skills and you may yet be chosen to fight in the front line as we retake the Molten Earth Arsenal!
Story message. Speaker: "Huy Jiang" (Vanguard, male) "Molten Earth Arsenal" is the name of a unique sector on the map (with a Promethean landmark).

Huy … is that really you? I thought I would never have the chance to meet you as a grown-up! When did you join the Vanguard? Do you have a wife and children? How did you survive for such a long time? There are so many questions! And Fang … my dear brother … does this mean he could still be alive as well?
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Fang" refers to "Fang Jiang", the father of Huy Jiang and brother of Daiyu Jiang.
Impossible. My family is dead. If my father were still alive he would shoot you himself. Tell your squad leader his attempts to trick me into his confidence will be met with gunfire.
Story message. Speaker: "Huy Jiang" (Vanguard, male) "father" refers to Fang Jiang.

Oh, no! It pains me to see that my brother decided to conceal the truth about my cryo-sleep mission. But this is no lie, Huy! I am truly your father’s sister - and I can prove it![br/][br/]Commander, I need your help! There is an interlocking pendant—a sort of family heirloom. My brother’s piece is hidden in a Repair Station. It was our secret. If we can recover it, Huy will believe us!
Story message. Speaker: "Daiyu Jiang" (Vanguard, female) "Repair Station" is the name of a strategic world map structure.
Seems like I have three options here: I can support Lt. Jiang on her search, wait for a different opportunity to convince Huy Jiang peacefully, or use military force to bring this to an end.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

I know of no Emerald Squad nor its leader, but I do know that all Vanguard take an oath to serve the Union. Soldiers around here have forgotten that. I come to remind them of their duties. Will you answer my call, Commander?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Serve the Union? There is no Star Union left to serve! The Empire abandoned us. One stranded frontier vessel won’t change anything about that. Your protocols and high ethics may have been enough to sustain you in cryo-sleep, Commander. Let’s wait and see if they are still that nutritive once they are the only thing you can feed on.
Story message. Speaker: "Huy Jiang" (Vanguard, male) "The Empire" refers to the Star Union.

I miss Lt. Jiang. She had a knack for diplomacy. Sad enough the name of my newly met ‘friend’ also has to remind me of her loss.[br/][br/]Really I have two options: Wait for another opportunity to reason with Huy Jiang or use military force to bring this to an end.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Convince Huy Jiang to Cease Fire
Find a way to convince Huy Jiang to end the infighting between the Vanguard, either through diplomatic or millitary means.
Convince Michael Valentine to Cease Fire
Find a way to convince Michael Valentine to end the infighting between the Vanguard, either through diplomatic or millitary means.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'. "Food Exploitation" is the name of a sector specialization that can be build in a colony.
Search for Fang Jiang's Family Heirloom
Go to Fang Jiang's former working place and search for the familiy heirloom described to you by Daiyu.

I hope this pendant of yours is made of Tricorium, Lieutenant, because this place looks like it has been wrecked by a hoard of angry Tyrannodon. How can you even be sure though, that this is where we need to search? For all we know your brother could have switched working places a dozen times before he resigned.

Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Tricorium" is the name of a strong and rare metal. "Tyrannodon" refers to the reptile creatures used as a mount by the "Amazon Tyrannodon" unit.

I didn’t want to bring this up earlier, but let’s just say that my parents were very preoccupied about any family members going missing. So they took some precautions. The pendants, they are more than just mere adornments…
What are they then? Tracking devices?! No wonder you never talk about your family!
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Yes, we could use them to find each other. When we landed, I located the pendant of my brother in this position. Last time I checked it was still here, but now… it appears to be … moving.

These are fresh Hopperhound tracks. I suspect one of those creatures scavenged your pendant. I remember several incident reports where exterminators found entire collections of shiny objects in a Hopperhound burrow.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Hopperhound" is the name of a marauder faction with several half hound half grasshopper units in them.
Find the Creature that Ravaged the Repair Station
Track down the creature that ravaged the Repair Station and took the familiy heirloom with it.
Who would have thought that PUG units could turn so feral? Seems like they must have done most of the repair station wrecking themselves!
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "PUG units" refers to the Vanguard PUG unit.
I am as surprised as you are, Commander. Makes me appreciate Tappels’ jolly nature even more. It’s time to thaw my Nephew’s memory with this pendant.
I am as surprised as you are, Commander. Makes me appreciate Tappels’ jolly nature even more. It’s time to thaw my Nephew’s memory with this pendant.
I am as surprised as you are, Sir! Makes me miss jolly old Tappels even more. With the pendant, let’s see if my nephew will be more reasonable this time!
I am as surprised as you are, Ma'am! Makes me miss jolly old Tappels even more. With the pendant, let’s see if my nephew will be more reasonable this time!

That heirloom belonged to my father! I thought it had been- … how did you? Alright. I guess if you are indeed my aunt as you claim, you at least deserve to know that my father died many years ago in a ‘work accident’. Being his sister, you know what that means.

Unfortunately, I have an entire squad of hungry soldiers to maintain. They are my family now. I am responsible for them. Show me you can provide for them and we’ll lay down our weapons and happily end this conflict.
I realize this must be hard for you, Lieutenant, but you knew something like this was sooner or later supposed to happen. We all did, when we left behind our former lives.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Prove to Huy Jiang that you will be able to provide for his people by controlling several sectors with a food specialization.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: Be careful to watch your colony happiness as you increase your food income, as larger colonies create more unhappiness.)[/recommendedcol]

Seeing that you spoke the truth about your identity, and how your squad handled the threats on this planet so far, I am willing to believe that we can actually put an end to this conflict. You have my full support, Colonel {STR_LeaderName}.

I am not going to lie: This war of words and treaties is more tiresome than assaulting a fortified Outlander base and should better be left to some diplomats to be fought out. But in the end what counts is that we finally got our Alliance with Huy Jiang.

Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Outlanders" refers to a non-homogenous group of out-casts and started rebelling against the Star Union at some of its outer-borders planets.
Huy Jiang is dead. He should have listened to us when he still could. It may sound harsh, but in the end he only became a victim of his own war.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
{STR_LeaderName}! I should have known it was you, who had returned to Leave-6. The air has reeked of arrogance ever since I heard the reports about the landed sleeper vessel.

Valentine?! Somehow I am not even surprised to find you alive. Bad weeds grow tall. Still, I never expected you to turn against your precious Paragon friends. What happened? Did they no longer look handsome enough for you?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Typical. Mocking other people’s misery! While you were frozen solid, the rest of us struggled for survival. My position granted me cryo-sleep access. With a war to fight, I’ve been in and out of cryo-sleep in anticipation of some sign the Star Union would return. Imagine my disappointment to learn it’s just you.
Spoken like a true hypocrite. This is why I always enjoy chatting with you. Fun times aside, don’t you agree that it is time to end this unnecessary bloodshed?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Unnecessary? I am not surprised that you fell for Huy Jiang’s innocent act. Go ahead. Ask him what he did that night in the Elysium Parks.[br/][br/]For my cooperation, prove you’re not just after my supplies. Go to Sector 43-B. PyrX fires threaten our energy reactors. Quench them and we can talk again!
Story message. Speaker: "Michael Valentine" (Vanguard, male) "Elysium Parks" is the plural name of a strategic world map structure. "Sector 43-B'' is the name of a unique world map sector.

A geothermal instability threatens the Imperial Energy Complex in Sector 43-B. Remove it![br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: To remove a Hazard you first need to complete the Society research 'Environmental Conditioning'. Once that is done you can move one of your armies on the hex with the Hazard and remove it for a cost in Energy and Cosmite.)[/recommendedcol]
A task description. "Sector 43-B'' is the name of a unique world map sector. "Imperial Energy Complex" is the name of a world map structure.

You completed your task? Good. Well? These fires didn’t ignite themselves. A bunch of renegades have fortified themselves in the Molten Earth Arsenal, where they got their hands on dangerous Promethean weaponry. Bringing these deserters to justice would go a long way to reestablishing order on Leave-6.
You are enjoying this, aren’t you? Ordering me around like some first year recruit. Just be careful the tasks you give me don’t cause me more trouble than ‘convincing’ you with a gun.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Find and eliminate the renegades that sabotaged the Imperial Energy Complex.
A task description. "Imperial Energy Complex" is the name of a world map structure.

Who would have thought I’d live to see the day that {STR_LeaderName} does something useful? Okay, so now the real test: the constant use of the Promethean weapons had some unwanted side-effects on the Quartzite near the Molten Earth Arsenal. They absorbed the PyrX fire and broke free. Get rid of them, and we can discuss an armistice.

Story message. Speaker: "Michael Valentine" (Vanguard, male) For "Quartzite" see the matching glossary entry. "Molten Earth Arsenal" is the name of a unique sector on the map (with a Promethean landmark).
Kill the empowered Quartzite near the Molten Earth Arsenal.
A task description. "Molten Earth Arsenal" is the name of a unique sector on the map (with a Promethean landmark).
The renegades are dead. You’ve had your fun, Valentine. I think it’s time to hammer out a truce!
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Very well. I am a man of my word. Let the negotiations begin!

If there was any more proof required that a Vanguard officer can set aside his personal feelings for his duty and the greater good, I think both Michael Valentine and myself have given such proof today. We are never going to be friends. But we serve the same flag and principles and in the end in a crisis like this that is all that matters.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Michael Valentine is dead. Given the differences we had in the past I am not exactly devastated by this news. However, I can’t feel like celebrating either. After all, despite his questionable character, Michael Valentine was still a Vanguard officer. And one of the last from my time.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

We know now that the different squad leaders have been employing Promethean weaponry throughout the planet. Huy Jiang mentioned the Molten Earth Arsenal, which had to be reconquered, so I would assume it is the supply base, where those weapons are stored and manufactured. Sounds like a place that we should pay a visit.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Molten Earth Arsenal" is the name of a unique sector on the map (with a Promethean landmark).

This bunker allowed the other Vanguard to turn this once idyllic planet into a wasteland. If we had an expert, I would prefer to disarm every single warhead and shut the whole place down. Unfortunately, time is pressing. I propose a much bolder plan: Claim the Molten Earth Arsenal ourselves and scare the other leaders into this much needed truce.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Molten Earth Arsenal" is the name of a unique sector on the map (with a Promethean landmark).
Look for the Molten Earth Arsenal from which the other Vanguard leaders obtain their Promethean weapons.

Annex the Molten Earth Arsenal to one of your colonies to root out the renegades that terrorize Leave-6 with their Promethean weaponry.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: To be able to annex a sector to a colony, that colony must be a maximum of two sectors away and have the necessary population to support an additional sector.)[/recommendedcol]
A task description. "Molten Earth Arsenal" is the name of a unique sector on the map (with a Promethean landmark).
The other leaders aren’t responding. There’s something missing in this whole matter. What was it Valentine mentioned about the Elysium Parks? I will investigate there.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

I am still not sure if Valentine was mocking me when he referred to the Elysium Parks. Sending me on a wild-goose chase through deteriorating pleasure parks sounds like something he’d enjoy. Still, I cannot ignore the possibility that he has a point. As opportunistic as he may be, Michael Valentine is still a Vanguard officer. Vanguard officers don’t joke about war.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Elysium Parks" is the plural name of a strategic world map structure.
A quest name. "Elysium Parks" is the plural name of a strategic world map structure.

Search the Elysium Parks to learn more about the incidents that lead to the escalation of the Vanguard conflict.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: This is an exploration quest. Use your scout units or other fast moving units to complete it.)[/recommendedcol]
A task description. "Elysium Parks" is the plural name of a strategic world map structure.
Stay away! Repulsive creeps! Didn’t you already do enough damage to us the last time?
Story message. Speaker: "Emma-3" (Elysium Park robot, female; one of the "Emma-3" units)
There, there, sister. Don’t cry! It’s not these humans fault. They are slaves to their instincts, just as we are to our programming. Stick to your programming. We like to be used.
Story message. Speaker: "Roy-2" (Elysium Park robot, male; one of the "Roy-2" units)
Calm yourselves, androids! We have nothing in common with the people who damaged you. We just want to talk.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Then why are you wearing their uniforms? Also, it is rude to call us androids, human! We have names.
Story message. Speaker: "Emma-3" (Elysium Park robot, female; one of the "Emma-3" units)

Very well, Emma-3, we are wearing Vanguard uniforms. Not every Vanguard is the same. We have rules. Sometimes people violate these rules. From what I can see, you’re a victim. By telling me what happened, I will find and punish the ones responsible.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

I… We were singing. Dancing. Officers in uniform joined us. Pleasure profile sensors indicated complete job satisfaction. Suddenly, three officers drew guns. There were blasts and death and… so much pleasure lost… broken... All paradigms ruptured. If you want to know more, talk to Laura-2. You should be able to find her in one of the other parks.
Story message. Speaker: "Emma-3" (Elysium Park robot, female; one of the "Emma-3" units) "Laura-2" is the name of a female Elysium Park robot.
Laura-2? Is that you? Emma-3 sent us. We want to ask you some questions about the night the fighting started. We heard that there were three officers involved. Do you remember their names?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Laura-2" is the name of a female Elysium Park robot. "Emma-3" is the name of a female Elysium Park robot.

Emma-3 sent you? I guess I can trust you then…[br/][br/]Yes, of course I remember their names, silly! I am a robot! It was Colonel Valentine, Colonel Garou and Lieutenant Jiang. They all wanted time with Ilia-5. I was bringing them another bottle of Champagne when they suddenly threatened each other with their guns.
Story message. Speaker: "Laura-2" (Elysium Park robot, female; one of the "Emma-3" units) "Ilia-5" is the name of a female Elysium Park robot.
Ilia-5? Another of your kind, I suppose?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Yes, but if you need to ask you are surely not from around here. Ilia-5 was the star of Leave-6. She was the latest model. With looks you would kill for... No wonder she caused a war.
Story message. Speaker: "Laura-2" (Elysium Park robot, female; one of the "Emma-3" units)

I can’t tell you how often the other Vanguard came looking for her since she ran off with Lieutenant Jiang – oh wait, I can! It was 243 times! Nobody knows where she’s hiding except Michael-4, and he’ll just pretend his audio processors aren’t working.
Story message. Speaker: "Laura-2" (Elysium Park robot, female; one of the "Emma-3" units)

Commanding officer bar fights, runaway succubots; I must say this whole affair is getting more and more bizarre![br/][br/]But now I want to get to the bottom of this! I guess we should pay this Michael-4 bot a visit…
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Are you Michael-4? We were told you know the location of Ilia-5? Don’t worry, we only need to ask her some questions.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

The vocation of Kilian’s wife? I didn’t even know he was married! Though I guess all Emperors had their secrets. Did you know that Emperor Khansu had so many trap doors in his throne room that it was impossible for his subjects not to trigger them accidentally?

Story message. Speaker: "Michael-4" (Elysium Park robot, male; one of the "Roy-2" units) "Emperor Khansu" is the name of a Star Union emperor that died by igniting his home world with PyrX fire, turning it into his planetary tomb.
You can drop the act Michael-4, we know you hear perfectly. Tell us where she is and we will leave you in peace.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Feed me grilled cheese? I prefer non-organic food... aw… er… Who am I kidding? After all these years, I’m tired. You can find her here. Scan for traces of Aethron. Oh and one more thing … please don’t tell her I told you. She has quite a temper.
Story message. Speaker: "Michael-4" (Elysium Park robot, male; one of the "Roy-2" units) "Aethron" is the name of a valuable psionically charged substance.
Search Ilia-5 at her hiding place indicated by Michael-4.
I don’t recognize you. You don’t seem to be like the other squad leaders… Please, tell me you’re my brave, strong rescuer. The other Vanguard have lost their minds!
Story message. Speaker: "Ilia-5" (Elysium Park robot, female; one of the "Emma-3" units)
A dialogue choice short form description.
A dialogue choice short form description.
Don’t worry, I will bring you safely to our core colony. Once you are there, the other Vanguard leaders will have to stop fighting over something out of their reach.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Thank you! Finally an officer with some common sense and manners. And a handsome one too!
Story message. Speaker: "Ilia-5" (Elysium Park robot, female; one of the "Emma-3" units)
I am sorry, but you have been the cause of too much killing. This ends now!
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

So it took the mighty Star Union almost 200 years to finally send somebody competent after me? Ha! How disappointing! Did they really think I spend all the time waiting without preparing for this moment? I hope they told you what I did to their Lieutenant at Nerion Gamma, because this here is going to be even nastier!
Story message. Speaker: "Ilia-5" (Elysium Park robot, female; one of the "Emma-3" units) "Nerion Gamma" is the name of a planet.
Lead Ilia-5 safely to your operation center.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Put an end to Ilia-5 and her bodyguards.
Nicely done, Colonel! Don’t look so surprised. I accept defeat, when I have been beaten fair and square by my opponent. Ilia-5 belongs with you now.
Story message. Speaker: "Huy Jiang" (Vanguard, male) "Colonel" is the military title of Jack Gelder within the Vanguard.
Well that was … disturbing. Apparently Valentine was right. There was more to this whole conflict than I realized. Speaking of the devil though, there he is calling me again.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Well that was … disturbing. Apparently Valentine was right. There was more to this whole conflict than I realized. Too bad he isn’t around anymore to give some more insight on what had actually been going on.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
{STR_LeaderName}! You know that I hate to say this, but good work! Ilia-5 was an Outlander spy. She had been gathering information from high-ranked officers for years before I uncovered her game.

Right before I could expose her, Huy Jiang interfered. He made it look as if we were fighting over her as lovers and that idiot Garou was playing right into his hands. In the end, we all suffered the consequences.
Story message. Speaker: "Michael Valentine" (Vanguard, male) "Garou" refers to Colonel Garou, a male Vanguard.
With that matter out of the way, I feel we should intensify our efforts concerning the Molten Earth Arsenal. Hopefully that will allow us to bring this needless conflict to an end.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
My, my! Look what we got here: More volunteers to serve the glorious cause of House Timur. I was starting to think this whole expedition may have been a waste of our resources.
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female) "House Timur" is the name of a Syndicate clan.

House Timur? Isn’t that the kind of pretentious name the Syndicate would give to their criminal organizations? You are the ones from the ship we encountered at the spatial rift, aren’t you?[br/][br/]I was supposed to find an entire Vanguard Squad at this location. Tell me what you have done to them and I may spare you and your Outlander friends!
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Oh, you are a feisty one! And so adorably clueless! I almost think I should keep you.[br/][br/]Don’t worry about your friends, darling, we took them into our care. You should have seen them before, they were all so awfully malnourished!
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)

Took them into your care? Turned them into slaves, you mean! The Kir’ko were only a small part of the living property we found as we inspected the Syndicate. Back then, I had to obey the law and accept whenever the ones responsible could buy themselves out of their punishment. But the situation has changed. I suggest you leave the planet immediately. Without your ‘volunteers’.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

I am sorry, darling, but the property of House Timur is nonnegotiable. However, I may be convinced to refrain from further acquisitions if I am compensated for the losses caused to me by such a withdrawal. I have a list of supplementary items that could be manufactured in your colonies. Provide me with enough of them and I shall reconsider your request.
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)

What should I do? I want Sina off the planet, but do we want another full-scale war? Meeting her demand seems risky since she may be stalling until back-ups arrive. The only thing I can say for sure is that whichever option I choose, dealing with her is not going to be an easy task.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Find a way to make Sina of House Timur retreat - or defeat her troops on the battlefield to drive the Syndicate off the planet.

Provide Sina with a list of supplementary goods that you can build in your colonies.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: You can find any available quest production options in the "Structure Production" panel of the colony center.)[/recommendedcol]
Sina provided you with a list of supplies that she asks for as a recompensation to leave the planet without further conflict.

I knew we would end up getting along just fine, darling. These supplies will be enough for the moment. Unfortunately, the same can’t be said about your less cooperative Vanguard friends. They destroyed several of our energy storage devices, leaving us without the reserves required for another journey through the Void. So unless you can help us replenishing our energy…
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)

… you won’t be able to leave the planet. Very clever! I don’t believe a word you are saying! Just be careful not to overstrain my newfound taste for diplomacy.[br/][br/]Oh and one more thing: Call me ‘darling’ again and I will personally make sure it’s the last time.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Make up for the energy losses caused to Sina by the attacks of the other Vanguard leaders.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: Once you have sufficient resources to complete the quest, reopen the quest from within the "Objectives" panel. There you can pay the resources.)[/recommendedcol]
Why the long face, Colonel? Don’t you think we are forming a great team? Me giving the orders and you …
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)

Speaking of which, there is one last thing I need you to do for me: One of my associates asked me to retrieve an implant from a dead Paragon officer. It is a tiny device of little value, nobody is even going to miss it, but without it I can’t return to my client. After all we Syndicate honor our contracts.
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)

Based on my experience using the words ‘Syndicate’ and ‘honor’ in the same sentence is either sarcasm or utter mockery. If I locate the device for you, you need to do better than just to leave the planet, I’m afraid. You will have to set free every single Vanguard soldier you enslaved since your arrival.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Nice try, Colonel. But as I’ve told you before, the property of House Timur is not open for negotiations. Especially not for donations.
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)
Then how about you leave the planet without the device right now and I don’t put a bullet in your pretty head?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Flattering me with empty threats won’t accomplish you anything, Colonel. If you had the military means to stop me this easily you would have attempted to do so already. Why throw away your diplomatic efforts now that you are so close to end this without further violence?
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)

Sina has asked you to perform a planetary scan and locate a very specific Paragon device. Our scanners will need to be adjusted to detect its signature.[br/][br/][recommendedcol](Hint: You can still interrupt the quest research for more urgent research projects and resume it later by accessing the "Special Research" at the bottom of the research overview.)[/recommendedcol]
Set up and perform a planetwide scan for the signature of the Paragon device Sina is looking for.
A research description. This research has no game play.
It was a pleasure doing business with you, darling. I hope we’ll meet again someday.
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)

And I hope you die rotting in the festering guts of a Kelurian Fireworm![br/][br/]I wonder if I have made the right decision here today. Sina is gone, but I have the feeling we haven’t seen the last of her or her kind. The fact alone that she could act so brashly on a Star Union planet is troublesome to say the least.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "Kerulian Fireworm" is the name of a worm creature inhabiting some Star Union worlds (not an in game unit!).

Good day, Colonel. It has come to my attention that you are having some trouble with Sina of House Timur. I heard of her demands and believe me they won’t be her last ones. I know a subtle and yet effective way to get her off the planet. Interested?
That depends: First tell me who you are and why you should even want to help me. Then we can talk.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
I am a friend. A friend who has a certain interest in seeing Sina retreat from this planet. Anything to damage House Timur.

I have incriminating information about Sina’s past. Her ascension onto throne Timur wasn’t all sunshine and roses. There are some people who’d try to kill her if they learned how she acquired her current position. All you would need to do is to show her you have proof of what happened and she should be more… cooperative.
A dialogue choice short form description.
A dialogue choice short form description.
And I suppose you can provide me with such proof? I am listening.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
I am sorry to disappoint you, 'friend', but the Vanguard don’t resort to blackmailing and shady deals with criminals. You can keep your dirty secrets for yourself.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Yes, indeed I can. Meet me at those coordinates. And be sure to be less noisy. From what I’ve seen stealth isn’t your soldiers’ most distinguished quality.

How very undiplomatic and shortsighted of you, Colonel. It seems you still haven’t realized how the times have changed. Relying solely on your Vanguard friends will not always be enough to keep you alive anymore. Be careful your narrow-minded principles don’t choke you to death.
Meet with the Rival House Agent
Go to the received coordinates to meet with the Syndicate agent.
Didn’t I tell you to be subtle about coming here? Now we have an entire gang of assassins on our hands!
Story message. Speaker: "Syndicate Agent" (Syndicate, female) "assassins" refers to the "Syndicate Guild Assassin" unit.
Either that or this was a trap all along. For all I know your whole story of trying to help me against Sina was just a set up to lure us here!
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
I suggest you make up your mind about this quickly. I have no intentions of dying here today.
Protect the agent against the assassins sent after her.
Countable objective description. The values in between {} will read something like '3/5'.
Good. That should have been all of them. Now let’s talk about my payment before I hand over the evidence.
Payment? Didn’t you say making Sina retreat would already benefit you just as much as it does help me?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Not quite correct, Colonel. I only said I had a certain interest in that to happen. Your involvement wasn’t necessary for me to go through with this, so obviously I should gain something in return for my generosity. But don’t worry, unlike Sina I am very modest in my demands. A few minutes of access to the Molten Earth Arsenal should compensate me for risking my life.

I think you have a very strange understanding of the word modest. Asking for access to a secret military facility is hardly a small request. There is no way for me to tell what the data you collect there may be used for. On the other hand, I would rather have you take a look at the facility while my men supervise you than see Sina claim the complex for herself and dig through its data base.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Compensate the agent by giving her access to the Molten Earth Arsenal.
You got what you wanted, now give me that evidence you spoke of!
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Very well, here it is: A cerebral control collar with the unique marking of House Timur. It belonged to Sina’s predecessor and uncle, whom she kept as an indentured slave in one of her labor camps. She doesn’t know that we were able to retrieve the poor man.

Story message. Speaker: "Syndicate Agent" (Syndicate, female) "Cerebral control collar" is the name of a Syndicate unit ability. It is used to subdue humanoids and turn them into slaves (or in game Syndicate Indentured units).
There are a lot of people in her family who would be very displeased if they learned their favorite benefactor did not pass away in that tragic shuttle accident Sina told them about.

I understand. And I hope I won’t have to deal with any of your kind again in the future. It’s nothing personal, just that I find your scheming and betrayal to be profoundly despicable.[br/][br/]Now on to contacting Sina …
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

What is it, darling? Are you here to give me a present? Wait! What’s this-? How did you-?! Who gave-?! … I demand you to return this collar to me! It is the property of House Timur and you have no business even seeing it!
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)

Well I heard there are actually quite a number of people who would be very interested to see this. Listen closely to what is going to happen next: You are going to free all Vanguard captives. Then you will pack up your ship and leave the planet, while I make sure this collar doesn’t fall into the wrong hands. A fair proposal, don’t you think?
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Very well, Colonel. You win. I leave. But know this: You have made yourself a powerful enemy today. This isn’t over yet!
Story message. Speaker: "Sina of House Timur" (Syndicate, female)

Sina of House Timur is no longer among us. Considering everything she’s been responsible for – even just the small fraction of her acts we could witness since her arrival – I must say, justice has been served. This will teach the Syndicate and their separatist friends! Hopefully they will think twice the next time they plan to act against the Union and its laws.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "seperatist friends" refers to the Outlanders.

I have lost a fine officer and good friend today. I remember Daiyu Jiang on her first assignment: She found a broken OWL unit behind enemy lines. She fixed it even though my chief engineer told her it was damaged beyond repair. Took her three days, but she did it just to prove him wrong.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female) "OWL" refers to the Vanguard OWL unit.

Daiyu Jiang fixed things even when they appeared irreparably broken. Not just robots, but people. I always considered her to be the adhesive bonding composite that held together my crew. Worst of all we weren’t even able to retrieve her body. All we have to honor her memory is a charred piece of her hat… and the pain.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Lieutenant! You look unsettled. If there is something bothering you, you know you can always speak your mind with me.
Thank you, Commander, but it’s nothing, really. No reason to be concerned, not a solid one anyway.
What is it, Daiyu? Just spit it out!

Alright, Commander. But you must promise to keep this between us and not embarrass me in front of the squad. Ever since we landed, I have had this eerie feeling that I am being watched. I can sense that something is off, but no matter how hard I pay attention, I can’t find any concrete evidence to support my paranoia.

Some paranoia may be healthy when you’re stuck between the battle lines of rogue Vanguard squads and an opportunistic Syndicate house. The last few weeks have been rough for everyone, first leaving our past lives behind in cryo-sleep, now this madness. Just don’t let this situation get to you, Daiyu. We’re all in this together.
Thanks, {STR_LeaderFirstName}. You are right – it was probably nothing.

Daiyu Jiang is dead! They found her night camp harried and with her charred remains still smoldering within the embers of PyrX fire – damn it, she even told me herself she felt being watched! I cannot believe that this could happen under my command, but I swear I’m gonna find whoever did this and make them pay for their crime!
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

In the meantime I have the sad duty to mourn for a lost officer and friend. I remember Daiyu Jiang on her first assignment: She found a broken OWL unit behind enemy lines. She fixed it even though my chief engineer told her it was damaged beyond repair. Took her three days, but she did it just to prove him wrong.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Daiyu Jiang fixed things even when they appeared irreparably broken. Not just robots, but people. I always considered her to be the adhesive bonding composite that held together my crew. Worst of all we weren’t even able to retrieve her body. All we have to honor her memory is a charred piece of her hat… and the pain.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Blieep. Biep. Blieeeeeeep. (The robot runs aimlessly into a wall, then stops and rotates its head a full 360 degrees.)
Story message. Speaker: "Tappels" (unique Vanguard PUG unit; the robot is a pet of Daiyu Jiang)
I know it isn’t easy, Tappels. Sit down here with me and pass a moment in quiet and peace to honor the memory of our friend.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

I realize we didn’t get off on the best foot, Colonel, I admit I am impressed by you. I don’t know what you’ll find on other planets, but if you need skilled officers I’d prefer to join you rather than stay stranded on Leave-6. If my aunt served with you, I won’t regret following her example.

I will be honest, {STR_LeaderName}. I don’t think I am ever going to like you. But that doesn’t mean I can’t acknowledge the fact that you didn’t stink up this place. Things aren’t half bad now. If you want a skilled officer to join you on your journey, I could be persuaded.
I am surprised, Valentine. That almost sounds as if you are willing to serve under me? Emphasis on the word ‘under’.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Arghh, you realize you could have just gracefully accepted my offer without pointing that out?
Yes, I know. But there are just some things in life a man can’t resist.
Yes, I know. But there are just some things in life a woman can’t resist.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

Now that we have brought the Vanguard conflict to an end I don’t see any further reasons to prolong our stay on Leave-6. I could give my troops a day off before we depart and let them celebrate in the Elysium Parks – for old times’ sake. But, after what transpired here, none of them are interested.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)

We have succeeded! The leaders of the different Vanguard Squads are either dead or have agreed to put an end to this conflict. Still only time can tell if the wounds and scars left on the planet and the people can be healed.
Story message. Speaker: "Jack Gelder" (Vanguard, can be both male or female)
Send Scout to Ruby Elysium Park
Send Scout to Emerald Elysium Park
Send Scout to Sapphire Elysium Park
Enter the Park to search for clues.
Use the fire extinguishers lend to you by Michael Valentine.
Look for the family heirloom of Fang Jiang.
Establish a link to the facilities' main computer.
A name of a hero equippment item.
A personal item of Fang Jiang. Grants [abilityblue]Targeting Flare[/abilityblue] to the user.
A description of a hero equippment item.
A name of a hero equippment item.

In the ongoing conflict, the Vanguard leaders are suspicious towards any other Vanguard.
